The Ithaca M37 is one of most recognized pump-action shotguns of the United States and has the longest production run for a pump-action shotgun in history. Designed for civilians, police and military alike, the Ithaca 37 is based on a 1915 patent by firearms designer John Browning, initially named the Remington Model 17. This shotgun utilizes a novel combination ejection and loading port on the bottom of the gun, leaving the sides closed to the elements. The "Riot" model is widely considered the standard issue M37.
